test_strategy_covers_all_types.notes: Unit tests: 14 new test cases across 2 existing test files. Integration tests: not required (hooks tested in isolation via child processes; dispatcher integration already covered). E2E: not applicable (framework-level user interaction). Security: not applicable (no new attack surface). Performance: not applicable (negligible overhead).

test_cases_exist_for_all_requirements.notes: 14 test cases covering all 4 FRs (FR-001: 7 TCs, FR-002: 7 TCs, FR-003: 6 TCs, FR-004: 4 TCs) and all 16 ACs. Every acceptance criterion from requirements-spec.md has at least one dedicated test case.

traceability_matrix_complete.notes: Traceability matrix has 16 rows mapping every AC to specific test case IDs. All 4 FRs and all 16 ACs are covered. 100% requirement coverage.

coverage_targets_defined.notes: 100% AC coverage, 100% branch coverage of new code, >= 569 total tests (555 baseline + 14 new). Article II baseline preserved.

test_data_strategy_documented.notes: Test data plan defines 8 input patterns (analyze, add, flagged analyze, advance, gate-check, build with gate, empty args) and 3 state patterns (gate-blocker active workflow, TEST_CORRIDOR, CONST_CORRIDOR). All data is inline -- no external dependencies.

critical_paths_identified.notes: 3 critical paths: (1) exempt action detection (analyze/add pass through), (2) non-exempt regression (advance/gate-check still blocked), (3) build verb NOT exempt (accidental over-exemption prevention).

article_II.notes: 14 test cases designed in Phase 05 before implementation in Phase 06. All tests specified with inputs, expected outputs, and rationale. Tests will fail pre-fix (RED phase) because EXEMPT_ACTIONS does not yet exist in the hook code.

article_VII.notes: Traceability matrix complete: 4 FRs + 16 ACs -> 14 test cases via 16 traceability mappings. 100% requirement coverage verified by cross-checking every AC against test case IDs. No orphan tests.

article_IX.notes: All GATE-05 checklist items pass. Required artifacts: test-strategy.md (includes test cases, traceability matrix, test data plan, coverage targets, risk assessment). Single consolidated document appropriate for targeted bug fix.

article_XI.notes: Integration testing not required -- hooks are tested as isolated child processes via runHook(). The pre-skill-dispatcher integration (hook chaining) is already tested by existing test suites. No new component interactions introduced.
